availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel M. Karrick (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer, musician in 18th Ky Inf USA)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer, musician, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Karrick. Father of Mary M. Karrick and Lucinda S. Karrick. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Pendleton County in 1860. Served as a musician in the 18th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from February 8, 1862, to April 4, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 25.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 3.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 11, 17.
